clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Probiotics in Reducing Infections and Allergies in Young Children During the Complementary Feeding Period
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Probiotics in Reducing Infections and Allergic Manifestations in Young Children During the Complementary Feeding Period

collaborator.agency: The Danish Council for Strategic Research

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the intervention is to examine the effect of the bacterial strain BB-12, provided for 6 mo, on the prevalence of infections and allergic manifestations in small children, and how BB-12 affects the immune system, the gastrointestinal tract and the microbiota. Children are enrolled during 2 winter seasons.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of days absent from day care due to respiratory and gastrointestinal infections
primary_outcome.description: Recorded weekly by the parents using web-based questionnaires

secondary_outcome.description: Number of children with at least 1 episode of a lower respiratory tract infection (LRTI). LRTI include bronchitis and pneumonia Recorded by the parents weekly using web-based questionnaires.

Number of children with at least 1 episode of diarrhea; Duration of episodes with diarrhea(days); Number of episodes/child/year with diarrhea; Number of days with vomiting. Recorded by the parents daily using web-based questionnaires
Number of days with fever Recorded by the parents using web-based questionnaires
Number of treatments with antibiotics during the intervention period Recorded weekly by the parents using web-based questionnires

Number of children developing allergies during the intervention period (asthma, allergic rhinitis, atopic dermatitis, food allergies); Age for diagnosis of allergies; Use of medication due to allergies. Recorded by the parents monthly using web-based questionnaires

secondary_outcome.measure: Absence from day care due to illness other than infections
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days the child is absent from day care due to illness, which is not due to infections. Recorded by the parents weekly using web-based questionnaires

secondary_outcome.measure: Parental absence from work due to illness of the child
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days a parent is absent from work due to illness of the child (infections and other illnesses, respectively) Recorded by the parents weekly using web-based questionnaires
Number of visits to a doctor due to infections and other illnesses, respectively. Recorded by the parents using web-based questionnaires

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Thymus size
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 6 mo (end of intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in thymic size during intervention period will be evaluated using ultraound

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in biological markers for the immune system
other_outcome.description: Analysis of biological material investigating the effect on the immune system by biological markers .

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in biological markers for gastro-intestinal tract
other_outcome.description: Analysis of biological material investigating the effect on the gastrointestinal tract.

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Biological markers of allergy
other_outcome.description: analysis of biological samples investigating the effect on allergy by biological markers at baseline and at 6 mo

arm_group.description: Daily intake of bifidobacterium animalis ssp. Lactis (BB12), 10^9 cfu/day, provided as powder in a sachet which can be added to food or drink.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 9 - 12 1/2 month at intervention start
- Start in daycare 4 +/- 2 weeks after intervention start
- Single born
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children born before 37th gestational week
- Children with a birth weight < 2500 g
- Children suffering from severe chronic illness
- Children receiving regular medication
- Children who have received antibiotics within a month before intervention start
- Children whose parents do not speak Danish
